message_1: Suppose X is a topological space with homology groups H_0(X) = Z, H_1(X) = Z/2Z, and H_2(X) = Z/3Z. Determine the Euler characteristic of X.
message_2:
The Euler characteristic of a topological space X, denoted as χ(X), can be computed using the alternating sum of the ranks of its homology groups. In this case, we have:

χ(X) = rank(H_0(X)) - rank(H_1(X)) + rank(H_2(X))

Since H_0(X) = Z, its rank is 1. For H_1(X) = Z/2Z, the rank is also 1, as it is a cyclic group of order 2. Finally, for H_2(X) = Z/3Z, the rank is 1 as well, as it is a cyclic group of order 3.

Now, we can compute the Euler characteristic:

χ(X) = 1 - 1 + 1 = 1

So, the Euler characteristic of the topological space X is 1.
